definition: decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: In the late Tianbac period of Tang Dynasty, Beidi served as a major battlefield for Tang and Tufang armies.
sentences.chinese: 天寶後期，北地多次成爲唐軍與吐蕃決戰的主戰場。

sentences.english: In hand to hand combat Josh and Quaritch fight to the death.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和誇裏奇以肉搏戰來決戰到死。

sentences.english: Terak confronted Noa, and the two dueled to gain the power drive crystal.
sentences.chinese: 泰拉克與諾亞展開決戰，爭奪動力水晶。

sentences.english: In the battle of New Taipei City, do you support party or candidates?
sentences.chinese: 決戰新北市，請問您支持政黨還是支持人選？

sentences.english: The final moment came at last.
sentences.chinese: 終於到了最後的決戰時刻了。

sentences.english: The decisive battle for Europe had only just begun.
Ok, but be quick please! We must fight decepticons to death.
sentences.chinese: 好的，但是要快點，我們要去和霸天虎進行決戰。

sentences.english: Only a decisive battle can settle the question as to which army is the victor and which the vanquished.
sentences.chinese: 只有決戰，才能解決兩軍之間誰勝誰敗的問題。

sentences.english: The enemy lost heavily in the decisive battle.
sentences.chinese: 敵人在決戰中損失慘重。

sentences.english: We are talking about financial Armageddon.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在談論金融大決戰。

sentences.english: The advent of the fourth quarter, year-end battle soon.
sentences.chinese: 四季度來臨，年終決戰在即。

sentences.english: If we want to win the war, we have to combine quickly decided battles with lasting confrontations.
sentences.chinese: 要想打贏這場戰爭，就要把速決戰和持久戰結合起來。

definition: to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
